symptoms.name: Abdominal pain
symptoms.pattern: Initially right lower quadrant, then shifting to left lower quadrant, aggravated by exercise

physical_findings: Distended and tympanic abdomen in upper quadrants
Mild epigastric tenderness on deep palpation
Absence of rebound tenderness or guarding
risk_factors: History of two dilatation and curettage procedures for elective abortion
Current use of oral contraceptive pills

imaging_findings.ultrasound: Bilateral septated ovarian cysts, free fluid in pelvis
imaging_findings.ct_scan: Rim-enhancing complex cystic lesions in adnexa, multiple nodules in both adnexa, peritoneal enhancement in pelvis, large amount of ascites, indeterminate 1 cm liver lesion, mesenteric soft tissue densities

required: Imaging findings consistent with PID and ascites (e.g., CT scan showing ascites, pelvic masses, and peritoneal thickening)
Exclusion of other etiologies through appropriate workup
supportive: Clinical presentation with abdominal pain, ascites, and pelvic masses
Laparoscopic findings consistent with Fitz-Hugh-Curtis syndrome and severe PID
